items.q: The organization Doctors Without Borders began in ____. a. England b. Holland c. Australia d. France

After 1978, Doctors Without Borders took a more professional approach because ____. a. it needed more money to do its work b. it admired the American techniques of fund-raising c. it wanted more political affiliations d. it wanted to work for the U.N.
To encourage more members to join, Doctors without Borders began to give ____ to members who worked in their headquarters or on long missions. a. gifts b. computers c. stipends d. language lessons

Doctors Without Borders takes an impartial view of the missions they go on and focuses on the needs of the people . In this sentence, the word impartial means ____. a. neutral b. promoting one side c. secretive d. an affiliation
At times, members of Doctors Without Borders give testimony about the events they have witnessed. To give testimony means ____. a. give evidence b. bring witnesses c. start a mission d. ask questions
Members of Doctors Without Borders are not afraid to confront difficult crisis situations. The word confront means ____. a. fund b. deal with c. avoid d. complain about

In 1999, Doctors Without Borders received ____ for its humanitarian work. a. new technologically advanced medical equipment b. the Nobel Peace Prize c. an Academy Award d. an increase in their stipends
Doctors without Borders have already been on missions in ____. a. Nicaragua, Russia, and Iran b. Rwanda, Kosovo, and England c. Bosnia, Afghanistan, and Ethiopia d. Afghanistan, Iraq, and Canada
A descriptive essay ____. a. is organized like a process essay b. does not include a narration c. does not include any exposition d. can include exposition and narration
The thesis statement in a descriptive essay includes ____. a. a statement of fact b. elements of the dominant impression c. a concluding remark d. an anecdote

A metaphor ____. a. is a word or phrase used to suggest a likeness between things or people being compared. b. uses as and like to show the comparison of two things c. always uses the word do or make d. is only found in poems
Candidates for political office give _____ speeches. a. mutual b. self-sustaining c. stipend d. campaign
Celia had decided to quit her job; then she waivered. What did she do? a. She smiled. b. She actually quit the job. c. She started to feel unsure. d. She decided to keep the job.
According to the reading, the volunteers wanted to _____ the skills they had in order to help others. a. improve b. utilize c. appropriate d. sustain
The Peace Corps works in _____ countries. a. self-sustaining b. developing c. mutual d. campaigning
The Peace Corps was established in _____. a. 1960 b. 1961 c. 1981 d. 1991
At first, the Peace Corps was supervised by _____. a. Senator Kennedy b. the University of Michigan c. Congress d. the State Department
Peace Corps volunteers _____. a. receive a monthly salary b. serve for two years c. speak only English d. serve in every country of the world
Robert Sargent Shriver ____. [COMP: set WOL] a. was the first director of the Peace Corps b. was a senator c. thought up the idea for the Peace Corps d. was the first Peace Corps volunteer
Figures of speech are colorful words or expressions used to make a comparison more vivid.
When Doctors without Borders first began, it had a lot of funding and grew very quickly.
Members of Doctors Without Borders believe that everyone has a right to medical and emergency care no matter where they live or who they are.
In 1987, Doctors Without Borders began a mission in the U.S.
A member of Doctors Without Borders told the U.S. Congress about an incident of gunmen shooting at random in Bosnia . In this sentence, the words at random mean with a clear plan of attack or target.
Doctors without Borders receives many donations from organizations and private individuals. A donation is a monetary contribution.
A simile is a comparison using like or as.
Two organizations that are connected to each other have an affiliation .
A judge in a courtroom is supposed to be impartial .
A mission is a job assignment that a person accepts.
Everyone in wealthy countries can easily obtain medical care.
Doctors Without Borders uses fund-raising techniques like those of political candidates.
Doctors Without Borders has had missions in about 180 countries.
A mutual decision is made by one person.
The worldâ€™s supply of oil is self-sustaining.
A stipend is the same as a monthly salary.
The people Peace Corps volunteers worked with were their counterparts .
Only volunteers in agricultural programs worked at the grass-roots level .
It is appropriate for Peace Corps volunteers to live the same way the local people live.
The Peace Corps became an independent agency in 1981.
Over 200,000 volunteers have served in the Peace Corps so far.
Peace Corps volunteers are expected to eat the same food as the local people.
Some Peace Corps volunteers teach people how to run businesses.
One goal of the Peace Corps is to prepare people from other counties to live in the U.S.
The Peace Corps only goes to countries to which it is invited.
A good description contains only supporting details.
A dominant impression is created by emphasizing the single most important feature of a person, place, or situation.
The body paragraphs of an essay help develop the dominant impression.
Which sentence that gives the dominant impression of Jim Jones?
What aspects of a descriptive essay are included in this introduction?
What words are used to create the dominant impression of Jim Jones?
